Attack XP : (the xp its white)

like @whi@135/135

item.title: Stats color?
item.dc:creator: @inuyasha_12345 inuyasha 12345
item.description:
@inuyasha_12345 wrote:

Do the refresh skills() one for sure, but it wouldn’t hurt doing the other too.
Inside the code

sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[0]+"", 4004); sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[2]+"", 4006); sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[1]+"", 4008);
The @whi@ is telling the server to make them white, so change it to what you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Stats color?
item.dc:creator: @Zaikill Zaikill
item.description:
@Zaikill wrote:

ok i want to make it white i put this ? :

sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[0]+"", 4004);
sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[2]+"", 4006);
sendQuest("@whi@"+playerLevel[1]+"", 4008);

To all ?

so i have found this code too :

public void setSkillLevel(int skillNum, int currentLevel, int XP) {
              if(skillNum == 0) {
sendQuest(""+playerLevel[0]+"", 4004);
sendQuest(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4005);
              }
              if(skillNum == 2) {
sendQuest(""+playerLevel[2]+"", 4006);
sendQuest(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4007);
              }
              if(skillNum == 1) {
sendQuest(""+playerLevel[1]+"", 4008);
sendQuest(""+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4009);
              }

Read full topic

item.title: Stats color?
item.dc:creator: @inuyasha_12345 inuyasha 12345
item.description:
@inuyasha_12345 wrote:

Yes, if you were to make them all yellow you would add them like this,

sendQuest("@yel@"+playerLevel[0]+"", 4004); sendQuest("@yel@"+playerLevel[2]+"", 4006); sendQuest("@yel@"+playerLevel[1]+"", 4008);
Search for it inside your client first, it should already be there.

Read full topic

item.title: Stats color?
item.dc:creator: @inuyasha_12345 inuyasha 12345
item.description:
@inuyasha_12345 wrote:

color of the lvl/lvl and exp/exp can be edited through the server

go into client.java and search for

playerlevel[1]

just search and somewhere you will find one of those for 0-20 skills and there should be either “@???@” or just a “”
inside the @'s you put three letters for the color
lre = light red
yel = yellow
blu = blue
bla = black
cya = light blue
dbl = dark blue
dre = dark red
red = red
there are lots of them, those are some named off of my head, hope this helps!

Read full topic
